docs.snippet: LOUISVILLE, April 28 (UP)Bill Casper Jr. of Bonita, Calif., gained a one-stroke victory in the $30,000 Kentucky Derby open golf tournament today with a 70 for 277.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, April 28 (UP)Bill Casper Jr. of Bonita, Calif., gained a one-stroke victory in the $30,000 Kentucky Derby open golf tournament today with a 70 for 277.
docs.abstract: W Casper Jr wins tourn; P Berg wins women's Western

headline.main: COAST PRO CARDS 70 FOR 277 TOTAL; Casper Defeats Thomson by Stroke at LouisvilleBoros Third at 280 THE LEADING SCORES Patty Berg Is Victor THE LEADING SCORES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 2 (UP)--Col. Jacobo Arbenz Guzman, former pro-Communist President of Guatemala, has received permission from the Uruguayan Government to come to this country as a political refugee, it was announced today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 2 (UP)--Col. Jacobo Arbenz Guzman, former pro-Communist President of Guatemala, has received permission from the Uruguayan Government to come to this country as a political refugee, it was announced today.

docs.snippet: SMALL, sensitively fashioned bronzes by Dorothy Dehner  are on view at the Willard Gallery, 23 West Fifty-sixth Street. They range from architectonic structures spreading on a flat base, to intricate, often witty compositions suggesting figures,...
docs.lead_paragraph: SMALL, sensitively fashioned bronzes by Dorothy Dehner are on view at the Willard Gallery, 23 West Fifty-sixth Street. They range from architectonic structures spreading on a flat base, to intricate, often witty compositions suggesting figures, gardens and classical themes.

headline.main: Art: Bronzes by Dehner; Exhibition Is at the Willard Gallery-- Work by Segal and Glinsky on View The Whitakers Report on Visit to Spain

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 10-The Atomic Energy Commission said today that observers from fortyseven nations had been invited to witness some of the shots in the forthcoming atomic test series in Nevada.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 10-The Atomic Energy Commission said today that observers from fortyseven nations had been invited to witness some of the shots in the forthcoming atomic test series in Nevada.

headline.main: AIDES OF 47 LANDS TO SEE ATOM TESTS; U.S. Invites Allies to Watch Shots of Tactical Weapons Beginning on May l6 Civil Defense Aides Invited India Not Invited

docs.snippet: An Inter-American Symposium on the Peaceful Application of Nuclear Energy convenes tomorrow at the Brookhaven National Laboratory, Upton, N.Y. More than one hundred visitors from Latin-American countries and an equal number of prominent United States...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Inter-American Symposium on the Peaceful Application of Nuclear Energy convenes tomorrow at the Brookhaven National Laboratory, Upton, N.Y. More than one hundred visitors from Latin-American countries and an equal number of prominent United States scientists and atomic experts will participate.
docs.abstract: US AEC, State Dept and ICA sponsor symposium for Latin-Amer scientists, Brookhaven Lab, NY
